intro: Euryops dyeri, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers consist of a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Euryops dyeri is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
